metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000052 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: fmtlib version prior to version 4.1.0 (before commit 0555cea5fc0bf890afe0071a558e44625a34ba85) contains a Memory corruption (SIGSEGV), CWE-134 vulnerability in fmt::print() library function that can result in Denial of Service. This attack appear to be exploitable via Specifying an invalid format specifier in the fmt::print() function results in a SIGSEGV (memory corruption, invalid write). This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit 8cf30aa2be256eba07bb1cefb998c52326e846e7.

criterions.comment: fmtlib package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.1+ds-2').
